About Me

Research Data Scientist with years of experience in healthcare and data analysis looking to work with progressive companies to solve operational and data analytical challenges. Achievements include designing and supporting a large HPC cluster for research and business intelligence purposes, utilized multi data sources to discover new actionable knowledge and reducing operational costs. Highly skilled in hypothesis testing, analytical process management, visual problem solving, and data story telling.

I am most skilled in: Problem Solving using Data and Overlanding

Papers | Publications

Association of telomeres and telomerase with clinical outcomes in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia a review of literature

Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) is the most common pediatric cancer.Telomere plays a key role in cancer development through impairment of chromosome stability.The purpose of this study was to report the current state of science of the role of telomeres and telomerase in children with ALL.

Natural variability of minimotifs in 1092 people indicates that minimotifs are targets of evolution

Since the function of a short contiguous peptide minimotif can be introduced or eliminated by a single point mutation, these functional elements may be a source of human variation and a target of selection. We analyzed the variability of ∼300 000 minimotifs in 1092 human genomes from the 1000 Genomes Project.
